Kup:

"choose your words wisely, my friend" said Kup by comlink "Elita is w=
atting news for her parets and..."

"uncle Kup????"said a tiny background v=
ioce "who is it, Uncle? is lord  Elder? Does he have news from my dad and m=
on?"

"Yes, little one... We have some news, and we will know it till my ol=
d friend Tucson and Lord Elder came back " replied Kup and now talking to T=
ucson and Lord Elder "We are waitting you"



From: Sandy 
Sent: Saturday, =
March 06, 2010 10:02 PM
To: nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com 
Subject: Re: Back to th=
e Ark


  
Tucson starts up his engine and rolls off slowly from the ramp o=
f the shuttle, with Lord Elder inside his cab. He wasn't much for burning r=
ubber needlessly, and always took caution instead of wrecklesness when it c=
ame to his driving habits. Right down to signalling a right turn when it ca=
me time to turn right, and keeping his speed at a reasonable clip. When he =
feels the ground beneath his tires become rough, he shifts into manual gear=
 to activate his all wheel drive system, and is careful to take it easy thr=
ough rocky river beds. Water splashes up over his cab, as does mud. But it =
doesn't bother him in the least.

" I wish I could say enjoy the ride, mayb=
e one of these days I can. According to my transmitter, we're quite a bit a=
 way from the Ark.. Estimated arrival time says about three hours... I wish=
 I could get there sooner but if I go too fast, I'll kick up dust, and that=
's a dead giveaway. This way, if I stick to moist ground for most of the jo=
urney, and if I can help it, through grassy plains, I may be able to avoid =
being seen. So far I think sticking to water ways is best. No dust, no prin=
ts, no scent, no can track."

He continues to buffer his and Lord Elder's s=
ignatures so is to appear that they are not even enroute to the Ark. While =
he travels, he taps into the Ark's com link.

" Kup, I'm sorry I didn't ans=
wer your question earlier, I'd rather tell you in person to not risk any in=
formation getting in the wrong hands. The less info we put out in the open =
the better. "

--- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, Preston Carroll <supercyclonu=
s@...> wrote:
>
> > "Gazoontite. Anyway, you can count on us Lord Elder. We=
 promise, we'll watch our backs every step of the way."
> >
> > Quickstride=
 shakes his head after sneezing.
> >
> > " We won't do anything you wouldn'=
t do, Sir. We'll have to move fast though, Lord Perseus probably needs us A=
SAP."
> >
> > Rat Trap opens the hatch door while on Quickstride's back.
> =
>
> > "Wish us luck guys. We're gonna need it."
> 
> Elder nodded and smile=
d at Rat Trap and Quickstride. "I wish you
> success, may Primus help both =
of you." he said as he watched them
> leave. "May he watch over all of us."=
 he said under his breath as he
> turned back to Tuscon."
> 
> > " I think =
we should leave the shuttle where it is and head toward the Ark on wheels. =
We can cover more ground that way. Plus, it's been a while since I've done =
any form of off road driving and if we keep off the main roadways, no one w=
ill ever suspect that we've gone back to the Ark instead of taking the bait=
."
> >
> 
> 
> Elder looked at the shuttle thoughtfully, resting a hand on =
it. "Hmmm"
> he said finally, "That might not be a bad idea." He depressed =
a few
> controls, trying to lock it down. Of course no lock is perfect.
> 
=
> He looked back at Tuscon, who had transformed into his vehicular mode alr=
eady.
> 
> > He transforms into his SUV mode and opens his door to Lord Eld=
er.
> >
> > "So who wants shotgun?"
> 
> With one last look back at the shu=
ttle Elder slid into the proffered
> door that Tuscon held open. "Let's go.=
 We have a lot of things ahead
> of us."
> 
> OOC: Don't forget, this is mi=
llions of years into Earth's past. Not
> only are there no roads, but every=
thing is completely wild, and you
> get to contend with things like Dinosau=
rs along the way! :)
> 
> Preston
>
